description.narrative:
FN är nu i sitt tredje år av implementeringen av Delivering-as-One (DaO). UNCT (UN Country Team) drivs under DaO common management accountability system och styrs av en UN Code of Conduct. UNCT stödjer Zambia under UN Development Assistance Framework (UNDAF) 2010-2015, och har antagit en gemensam Common Business Operations Strategy.
2014 påbörjade UNCT Zambia, tillsammans med regeringen, processen med att ta fram och utveckla en ny Sustainable Partnership Framework (SDPF) för Zambia för att ersätta UNDAF 2010-2015. SDPF inkluderar även komponenter för att stödja One Programme, Common Budgetary Framework, och Common Business Operations Strategy samt en stärkt Communicating as One strategi. Detta är en krävande förändringsprocess som kräver strategiskt fokus, genomgripande koordinering av UNCT, regeringen och utvecklingspartners samt en genomtänkt implementering av såväl nya strukturer som prosesser. DaO bedöms ha flera fördelar såsom reducerade transaktionskostnader och harmoniserade operationaliserade prosesser.
Sverige har ett pågående stöd till att stärka DaO processen i Zambia. En gemensam slutsats av Svenska Ambassaden i Lusaka och UNRCO är att det krävs en förbättrad koordinering av RCO (resident coordinators office), inte minst under utvecklandet och framtagandet av en ny UNDAF. Tjänsten som Strategisk Rådgivare (Strategic Advisor) på RCO skulle spela en nyckelroll i att förverkliga och effektivisera denna process. En liknande tjänst har finansierats av Svenska Ambassaden i Nairobi, och det set ut som denna tjänst har en stor chans att positivt kunna influera DaO processen i Kenya.

Financing of a Senior Strategic Adviser to the UN Resident Coordinator's Office in Zambia. The Adviser will strengthen the capacity of the UN Resident Coordinator's office to mjanage and drive the UN Delivering as One process.

The objective with the contribution was to strengthen the Zambian Delivering as One (DaO) process, which aims to accelerate efforts and increase coherence and effectiveness of UN operations in the field. The contribution was a special arrangement to fund a Strategic Advisor at the UN Resident Coordinator's Office in Zambia. The results of the work of the UN Resident Coordinator´s Office have a direct impact on the work of the UN Country Team in Zambia, ensuring complementarity of efforts to maximize the effectiveness of the UN in Zambia. In this, a key result was the effective transition to a new stage of Delivering as One in Zambia, with One Programme, a Common Budgetary Framework (including a Joint Resource Mobilisation strategy but not One Fund), a more robust system of Operating as One, and a further development of Communicating as One.

description.narrative: The UN Resident Coordinator is responsible for the delivery of the UN Country Team, consisting of 15 UN organisations, towards acheiving the Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) in Zambia. Considering the complexity and width of the SDGs it is vital with a high level of integration and collaboration across the different actors. The UN Resident Coordinator in Zambia is supported by a team of professionals that make up the Resident Coordinator's Office. To increase the effectiveness of the Office a Strategic Advisor was employed in 2016, with funding from Sweden. The Strategic Advisor has worked in the Office during 2016 and 2017. The arrangement was that the funds were to be used for two years. While the team has worked as a collective, the Strategic Advisor has had an important role to coordinate and integrate analysis and planning between the different UN organisations, enabling them to Deliver as One. In 2017, the Resident Coordinator Representative and the Strategic Advisor ensured that all joint workplans reflected the SDGs and programming principles such as Leave No-one Behind, Human Rights, Genders, Sustainability and Accountability. The work has resulted in a stronger UN Country Team, Delivering as One in Zambia. The strong focus on the SDGs has enabled the UN Country Team, especially the UN Coordination Office, to be an imporant partner in the Government's development of the 7th National Plan, which lays out a strategy for development in Zambia. This has contributed to the Plan being fully mainstreamed to the SDGs and Zambia has become one of the best practices in this regard. The plan consists of pillars that integrate Economic Development, Poverty Reduction, Human Development, Reduction of Inequality and Governance and Rights. A UN Inter-Agency Task Team worked with the UN Resident Coordinator to drive the process throughout 2017 and brought in a variety of technical expertise from different UN agencies. The close collaboration between the UN Country Team and the Government has enabled a new approach to partnership, embracing a broad spectra of actors in Zambia. A specific focus has been on Zambian Youth. The Strategic Advisor has played a significant role in this process.
